result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dennis J Brantner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Dennis J Brantner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is not eligible for either the Challenge Incarceration or the Substance Abuse Programs.

To pay supervision fees as determined by the DOC.

Defendant shall authorize DOC to withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution.  The balance due shall be a condition of extended supervision/parole.  If discharged with financial obligations owing, a civil judgment shall be entered and/or other collection procedures will be implemented.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
To pay supervision fees as determined by the DOC.

If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

AMENDED - 10-13-22 Court grants Post Conviction Motion to amend 333 days sentence credit to 1,641 days.
AMENDED 1-27-2021:  Pursuant to Supreme Court decision, the Circuit Court readdressed the entire case and:  1)  Convictions on counts #1 and 2 were vacated.  2)  The previous sentences of Judge Grimm were vacated and the Court resentenced defendant on counts #3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10.
AMENDED 8-13-2021:  Sentence credit amended to reflect 333 days.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.
